intro: Galium samuelssonii var. samuelssonii, commonly known as Samuelson's bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, sprawling stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its habitat.
